Did you know that the #Monero genesis block contains a hidden message in the coinbase field?

https://xmrchain.net/block/0
https://moneroblocks.info/block/0
Look for the "Coinbase" or "Extra" field; it appears in plain text.

Why is it visible?
And what does the message say?

The coinbase field is special in the block (not a regular transaction). It doesn't use RingCT or stealth addresses, so it's not private.
From block 1 onward, all transactions are opaque.

"The Times 07/Apr/2014 Bank of England warns over digital currencies"

notes.content:
From a technology perspective zk-snarks is more private than RingCT is.
I'm not saying Z-cash is better, I am saying zk-SNARKS are better than RingCT.

FCMP++ would make their privacy at similar levels then Monero would be the obvious winner without a doubt.
But right now, their tradeoffs, and privacy benefits are similar.

I personally use Bitcoin, Monero, and Z-cash, as well as other payment types when I have to.

I'm a multi-coiner but I prefer, Bitcoin, Monero, and Z-cash the most out of the three, as I see they have the most plausible real world utility currently.

Just learned this Piconero. My dogs name is Pico. How cute. 


Cryptocurrency Unit: In the context of the cryptocurrency Monero, "piconero" is the smallest unit of the currency, equivalent to 10^-12 Monero (0.000000000001 XMR). This denomination uses the SI prefix "pico-" to denote the extremely small value. It was originally called a "tacoshi" but was renamed for consistency and ease of use.

Monero and the Battle for Decentralization: from CryptoNight to RandomX

In 2013, the CryptoNote protocol introduced CryptoNight, an algorithm built to democratize mining: anyone could mine with a regular CPU or GPU, avoiding the ASIC dominance that centralized Bitcoin‚Äôs hash power.

#Monero adopted it in 2014, but by 2017‚Äì2018, manufacturers like Bitmain had developed ASICs capable of breaking that balance. The community fought back with regular hard forks and variants such as CryptoNightV7 and CryptoNightR, defending decentralization through constant adaptation.

The real breakthrough came in 2019 with RandomX, designed by the community (led by tevador and hyc). This new algorithm uses random code execution and memory-intensive operations, making ASIC development economically unfeasible.

As of 2025, Monero remains CPU-friendly, proving that #privacy and #Decentralization aren‚Äôt slogans ‚Äî they‚Äôre coded into the protocol itself.

Why is #Monero pumping? ü§î

Mainly anonymous liquidity as digital cash. Secondly wealth protection - as an alternative to anonymous offshore companies and bank accounts. 

Due to the exclusion from the existing financial system (USD/FIAT) including most CEXs, money don't flow easy in an easy out of Monero. Any large transfer into XMR (looks like a pump) is not followed by an equal sized dump.

- Risk-averse: Almost devoid of leverage (important: this is what makes all other assets classes crash on a downturn) and custodial setup, Monero offers protection against failures or fraud from financial institutions, government actions and personal threats or legal battles.

- Proven Resilience against all sorts of attempted attacks.

- The vast majority of the world's population is migrants, refugees or descendants. Where confiscation of property, bank accounts, gold is standard procedure even today. Monero is one of the few assets that can not be confiscated (or labeled and traced). You can cross the border and start a new life without worries.

- Monero is not a get rich quick scheme (compared to what you see with other coins). The growth is organic and reflects healthy, steady appreciation rather than speculative hype. But, it still do pretty well...

Yeah I addressed that counterargument preemptively by mentioning Snowflake and obfs4 proxies. These are ran by any user (anybody with a browser can run snowflake proxies) and are nearly impossible to censor without outright bans of all international internet traffic. 

I agree we ought to have a more decentralized means of transmitting information than the internet, but Monero is still very resiliant even under draconian internet censorship thanks to Tor and i2p.

Here‚Äôs the English translation and hashtags for your text:

---

Monerujo is a popular Android wallet for the cryptocurrency Monero (XMR), continuing to evolve in 2025 while maintaining its reputation among users who value privacy. ([HeLa][1])

---

### üÜï What's New in Monerujo v4.1.6 ‚ÄúExolix‚Äù

The latest update, released on February 24, 2025, includes several improvements:

* Added Arabic localization and updated translations in Swedish, Turkish, and French.
* Fixed toolbar display under the notification panel.
* Improved IPv6 address handling when connecting to nodes.
* Updated the list of standard nodes and Exolix integration API.
* Added a monochrome launch icon for better theme compatibility. ([monero.com][2])

---

### üîê Key Features of Monerujo

* Non-custodial wallet: users retain control of private keys.
* Ledger hardware wallet support for added security.
* Manage multiple wallets, accounts, and addresses in one app.
* ‚ÄúStreet Mode‚Äù: hides balances when using the wallet in public.
* Automatic scanning of public nodes for blockchain synchronization.
* Own node support for users seeking maximum control.
* Integration with KYC-free exchangers like Exolix and SideShift for XMR swaps without identity verification.
* OpenAlias support for easy address sharing.
* Wallet backup functionality to securely store notes and address names. ([APKMirror][3], [Pgyer][4], [monerujo.en.aptoide.com][5], [Google Play][6])

---

### üì• Where to Download

Monerujo is available on:

* [Google Play](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.m2049r.xmrwallet)
* [F-Droid](https://f-droid.monerujo.io/fdroid/repo/)
* [APKMirror](https://www.apkmirror.com/apk/m2049r/monerujo-monero-wallet/) ([Google Play][6], [GitHub][7], [APKMirror][3])

---

### üõ† Conclusion

Monerujo remains one of the top choices for Monero users on Android, combining convenience, security, and consistent updates. Its open-source code and active developer community ensure reliability and trust among users. ([HeLa][1])

---

For more information and support, visit the official website: [monerujo.io](https://monerujo.io/)

---

### üîñ Hashtags

#Monerujo #Monero #XMR #AndroidWallet #CryptoWallet #Privacy #Blockchain #NonCustodial #CryptoSecurity #Exolix #CryptoUpdates #OpenSource #Cryptocurrency

---

notes.content:
Unfortunately, I am not so optimistic. At least, certainly not in our lifetime when it comes to "millions".

My idea is simple: take the average liquidity circle that ~80% of people will need: 

* goods: vegetables, meat, fruits, bread, milk, other farm products such as honey, jam, preserves, etc.

* services: cleaning, dry cleaning, electrician, plumber, home repairs, food delivery (from a private individual, where you can call the person and ask them to go to your favorite restaurant, buy you food, and you pay them in XMR)

... and start personally visiting small businesses, educating them about Monero, explaining how to use XMRbazaar, helping them set up an XMR wallet, etc.

A very important question that needs to be answered *correctly* is taxes. That is, if you openly tell merchants, "Don't pay taxes" they may get scared. In this case, the appropriate solution would be to explain that "if you want to pay taxes so badly, then, for example, if someone buys goods from you for 30 EUR, just take 30 EUR in cash out of your wallet and put it in the cash register".

You just never know when and how the state will send its dogs to tear you apart.

Also, I think such businesses need to start using Nostr. This way, they will:

1) get rid of the unnecessary noise of regular social networks

2) have a direct target audience ready to buy with crypto
Use Monero
Is monero pumping?

The question I‚Äôm getting tired of answering is when people say ‚ÄúBitcoin is failing because institutions are getting involved.‚Äù

What did you think was going to happen? That only the plebs would figure it out, and the largest capital allocators in the world wouldn‚Äôt? The guy who can‚Äôt put his cart back at the grocery store will grasp Bitcoin before someone managing a multi  billion-dollar portfolio? C‚Äômon‚Ä¶

I respect a lot of the Monero bros, but I can‚Äôt take the criticism seriously when they can‚Äôt explain how things would be any different if Monero reached Bitcoin‚Äôs scale and institutions started adopting it. Would they suddenly call Monero ‚Äúcaptured‚Äù because people they don‚Äôt like are financializing it? Doubt it.

nostr:nprofile1qy3hwumn8ghj7un9d3shjtt5v4ehgmn9wshxkwrn9ekxz7t9wgejumn9waesqgryl6hnpzvpcg5lcqe7v27fqdg8en5r5jeghgr2ew6wnwe2dylvm5vpe6l9
https://www.tradingview.com/x/6Dm33Qc3/
The price of Zcash is recording one of the most astonishing rallies in the crypto market despite the ongoing bearish conditions. Over the past few weeks, we have seen a resurgence in the privacy narrative. Zcash (ZEC), one of the oldest and best-known privacy coins, is up by about 700% since September.¬† The pump in recent days is notable, as it comes at a time when the entire crypto industry is being dragged down due to Bitcoin‚Äôs decline towards $100,000. It raises the question of how Zcash is managing this performance, and there are different theories on social media as to why this is happening. Related Reading: XRP‚Äôs Price Doesn‚Äôt Match Its Growing Real-World Use, Study Finds What‚Äôs Going On With Zcash? Zcash (ZEC) has risen over 700% since September 2025, reaching as high as $728 on November 7, according to data from CoinGecko. This rally comes ahead of its mid-November halving, which will halve block rewards to 0.78125 ZEC, tightening supply like Bitcoin‚Äôs events. According to a recent report analysis by Galaxy Digital, Zcash‚Äôs extraordinary rally can also be attributed to a revived interest in privacy within the crypto space. The report noted that although Zcash‚Äôs underlying fundamentals have not drastically changed, perceptions of its zero-knowledge proof system have.¬† More than 30% of the coin‚Äôs total supply is now locked within shielded pools, representing an all-time high for private usage on the network. This rally means that some users are increasingly seeking privacy-centric solutions as mainstream networks grow more transparent and subject to surveillance.¬† Another factor contributing to Zcash‚Äôs rise is the recent tech upgrades to its network. The introduction of the new Zashi wallet, which makes private transactions far more user-friendly, has expanded Zcash‚Äôs accessibility to a wider audience.¬† Prominent voices like Naval Ravikant and Arthur Hayes have championed Zcash‚Äôs role in the evolving privacy revolution, calling it ‚Äúthe missing piece for Bitcoin.‚Äù According to the BitMEX co-founder, Zcash has the potential to quickly achieve 10% to 20% of the value of Bitcoin, which would place its price between $10,000 and $20,000. Interestingly, Arthur Hayes‚Äô Maelstrom fund now holds ZEC as its second-largest liquid asset. Can ZCASH Keep Pumping? Despite the euphoria, some analysts caution that Zcash‚Äôs dramatic rally may not be entirely rooted in long-term fundamentals. Economist Lyn Alden described the surge as a coordinated token pump, warning investors not to become exit liquidity. A crypto commentator known as Bit Paine on X suggested that the current Zcash rally may be a coordinated pump-and-dump, arguing that manipulators likely targeted the coin because privacy tokens had their big moment in 2017, meaning many new investors may be unaware of the pattern, and privacy-focused assets like Zcash make it easier for bad actors to conceal their activities from regulators. Related Reading: Bitcoin Near Breaking Point As It Tests Its Most Crucial Support Line‚ÄîAnalyst There is also looming regulatory pressure over privacy coins, especially after the European Parliament‚Äôs vote to restrict listings of tokens like Zcash and Monero on regional exchanges beginning in 2027. At the time of writing, Zcash is trading at $580.67, having retraced from its intraday high of $734.96. Featured image from Vecteezy, chart from TradingView
https://www.newsbtc.com/altcoin/zcash-explodes-700-since-september-whats-driving-the-rally-amid-the-bear-market/
tags: Zcash Explodes 700% Since September ‚Äì What‚Äôs Driving The Rally Amid The Bear Market?

Zcash's remarkable price increase is attributed to a resurgence in the privacy narrative and recent tech upgrades to its network. The introduction of the new Zashi wallet has made private transactions more user-friendly, expanding Zcash's accessibility to a wider audience. Prominent voices have championed Zcash's role in the evolving privacy revolution, calling it 'the missing piece for Bitcoin'.
